args.natural_language_statement: Translate the following and check correctness: Using (AB)^{-1}=B^{-1}A^{-1} and (AB)^T=B^T A^T, prove that O(n)=\{A in Mat_{n×n}(R) : A A^T = I\} is a group under matrix multiplication. Save it to: srdoty_alg_linear-gps_358.lean

{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap

/-- Using (AB)^{-1}=B^{-1}A^{-1} and (AB)^T=B^T A^T, prove that O(n)=\{A in Mat_{n×n}(R) : A A^T = I\} is a group under matrix multiplication. Save it to: srdoty_alg_linear-gps_358.lean -/

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- The orthogonal group O(n) over a field R is the set of n×n matrices A with AᵀA = I. -/

def orthogonal_group (n : ℕ) (R : Type*) [Field R] : Type _ :=
  { A : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) R // A ⬝ Aᵀ = (1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) R) }

theorem orthogonal_group_isGroup (n : ℕ) (R : Type*) [Field R] :
  IsGroup (orthogonal_group n R) := by
  sorry

/-- Show that the orthogonal group forms a group under matrix multiplication. -/
theorem orthogonal_group_isGroup (n : ℕ) (R : Type*) [Field R] : IsGroup (orthogonal_group n R) := by
  sorry
